results.title: Robin Hood [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Wolfgang Reitherman
results.brief_description: This animated feature was one of the first films to be made by Disney after Walt’s death in 1967. Adapting the story of Robin Hood, in this take all the protagonists are animals - Robin is a handsome fox (very much in Errol Flynn mode), Little John is a bear and Prince John a lion. When the greedy sheriff taxes the citizens of Nottingham to the point of bankruptcy, Robin Hood, a benevolent outlaw arrives to save them all. Director Wolfgang Reithermann has created a fantastic animal kingdom in which to set the classic tale of the inhabitants of Sherwood Forest. Voices include: Peter Ustinov and Terry-Thomas, Andy Devine, Barbara Luddy, Roger Miller and Monica Evans.

results.title: Robin Campbell: old feller now: memories of a Muruawarri (A)
results.creator_credit: Goodgabah Productions, Alec Morgan and Martha Ansara
results.brief_description: Robin Campbell, an old man of the Murrawarri tribe of the far north west of New South Wales recalls, through dramatic re-enactments by his young relations, how he was taught, as a child, to hunt the emu and make animal tracks, and how he worked as a drover in the 1930’s and 40’s. Narrated by Bill Reid.

results.title: Robin
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Tom Manefield and Jan Sharp
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Why can’t they be like we were?”.
Because she is overweight, Robin has had problems of acceptance with her peer group. The film explores the ways in which acceptance of group norms can affect relationships with people within and outside the group and the issue of peer group power structures at a school.

results.title: Robert Rooney
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions, National Gallery of Victoria, Bob Weis, Judi Stack and Robert Rooney
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Robert Rooney’s art is a personal analysis of his own life, and in examining his own idiosyncratic behaviour he is exploring the routines and obsessions that concern each and every one of us. These routines are perhaps meaningless to some, yet they consume a major part of our everyday life

results.title: Robert Richard Torrens
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Frank Bagnall and Lilias Fraser
results.brief_description: An account of the origin and history of the Torrens Title System. Shows Torrens’ work as Registrar-General and Member of Parliament, in the securing of land tenure in South Australia. Insecurity had plagued early settlers in South Australia, until Torrens’ land title reform bill was passed in 1857. Unsatisfactory registered transactions were replaced by a single certificate, one copy being held by the Registrar-General and the other by the owner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Frank Bagnall and Lilias Fraser

results.title: Robert Penn Warren
results.creator_credit: Dynamic Films and Educational Television and Radio Center
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers of today”.
A re-release of a ‘50s interview with American novelist, playwright and poet, Robert Penn Warren (“All the King’s Men”). It was originally recorded for the Educational Television and Radio Center as part of a series, hosted by Walter Kerr, New York Herald Tribune drama critic, on the role of the writer as thinker and creative artist. Penn Warren discusses the value of teaching creative writing, the “germ” of an idea that “fires up” the writer, the sense of place and recurrent themes in his writing.

results.title: Robert Mapplethorpe
results.brief_description: Mapplethorpe’s studies of nude black men were a shameless affirmation of gay sexuality. He has been credited with helping to formulate a sense of gay identity in New York, but as one of the most successful photographers of modern time, his work has also been instrumental in restoring the male nude to mainstream art. This program charts Mapplethorpe’s career from student to leading figure in the art world.

This program charts Mapplethorpe’s career from student to leading figure in the art world.

results.title: Robert Klippel: metal construction, 1960
results.creator_credit: Firebird Films, Arthur Cantrill and Corinne Cantrill
results.brief_description: A complex sculpture by Robert Klippel constructed of steel rods and copper plates, accompanied by electrically manipulated vocal sounds and percussive effects. Music: Larry Sitsky.

results.title: Robert Klippel. 4. Junk sculpture, 1963
results.creator_credit: Firebird Films, Arthur Cantrill and Corinne Cantrill
results.brief_description: A sculpture by Robert Klippel incorporating parts of discarded machinery with forms cut from sheet metal accompanied by music written for strings and percussion. Music: Larry Sitsky.

results.title: Robert Klippel. 3. Junk Sculpture, 1963
results.creator_credit: Firebird Films, Arthur Cantrill and Corinne Cantrill
results.brief_description: Incorporating music and light, this film explores a sculpture by artist Robert Klippel. Made of machinery and sheet metal, the various plays on angle and light take the viewer inside the artwork and allow a range of perspectives.
